class_notes:
ENVS 120 or ENVS 130 or ENVS 131 or ENVS_OX 131 or ENVS 140 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.


This course is an introduction to air pollution science, focusing mainly on the physical processes occurring in the atmospheric boundary layer. Using the knowledge and the skills gained through this class, students will be able to: 1) explain a broad range of atmospheric phenomena and processes that impact air quality; 2) understand how air quality problem relates to their everyday lives; 3) analyze environmental data and predict potential air pollution events; and 4) critically assess public discussions and media coverage of air quality related issues.
course_description: A course designed for second year students on topics of interest in environmental sciences. This course may count as elective credit for the ENVS major and minor; relevant topics may count towards the ENVS Sustainability Sciences or Earth and Atmospheric Sciences minors. See current course atlas.
schedule_location: TTh 2:30pm-3:45pm in Math & Science Center - W501
